1 . Giza Necropolis

Price : S$ 20.83Recommended sightseeing time: : 5-6 hoursAddress : Al Haram, Nazlet El-Semman, Al Giza Desert, Giza Governorate 3512201, EgyptDistance : 597mWhat travelers say : M53***77 : Under the signboard of the relics of world civilization, you have to go once. Unless you really have research or love this thing, it feels like ordinary people will not choose to come for the second time. There is no difference in following up the village, the smell of shit is heavy, the quality of the locals is not high, go in to ride a horse and camel, in addition to the money that should be given, there are tips, anyway, it is a common phenomenon in places with poor living standards, so no matter what you do, keep an eye on it.

2 . The Museum of Egyptian Antiquities

Price : S$ 45.54Recommended sightseeing time: : 2-3 hoursAddress : Midan El Tahrir Geographical Society Building, Cairo 11511 EgyptDistance : 1.44kmWhat travelers say : Todemmy : [View] Going to Egyptian Textile Museum is more popular, and when I come to The Grand Egyptian Museum, I found that there is no one at all. There is a feeling of private rooms. It feels beautiful to come back to organize the photos!

3 . Cairo Citadel

Price : S$ 17.91Recommended sightseeing time: : 1-2 hoursAddress : 27H6+G27, Privet Entrance Bel Kalaa, Al Abageyah, El Khalifa, Cairo Governorate 4252360, EgyptDistance : 2.89kmWhat travelers say : Syed Hussen : The Citadel of Cairo or Citadel of Saladin (Arabic: ŸÇŸÑÿπÿ© ÿµŸÑÿßÿ≠ ÿßŸÑÿØŸäŸÜ, romanized: Qala øat SalƒÅ·∏• ad-Dƒ´n) is a medieval Islamic-era fortification in Cairo, Egypt, built by Salah ad-Din (Saladin) and further developed by subsequent Egyptian rulers. It was the seat of government in Egypt and the residence of its rulers for nearly 700 years from the 13th to the 19th centuries. Its location on a promontory of the Mokattam hills near the center of Cairo commands a strategic position overlooking the city and dominating its skyline. When it was constructed it was among the most impressive and ambitious military fortification projects of its time. It is now a preserved historic site, including mosques and museums.

4 . Pyramids of Dahshour

Price : S$ 6.02Recommended sightseeing time: : 2 hoursAddress : Dahshur, Monshaat Dahshour, Badrshein, Giza Governorate, EgyptDistance : 4.51kmWhat travelers say : juki235 : Dehshur is a site in the ancient Egyptian pyramids. It used to be a remnant of a city. Now it is only a vast desert, but many relics have been excavated here, showing that it was a large-scale city. It is an important archaeological site in the Egyptian pyramids area and is worth visiting.
